import React from "react"; import { FaFolderOpen } from "react-icons/fa"; function Portfolio() { return (

HR Portfolio Highlights

Recruitment & Hiring

At OGISL, I played an integral role in improving our student hiring process. I drafted job descriptions that highlighted skills over credentials to make applications more accessible to international students. I also redesigned the interview rubric using behavioral indicators aligned with the NACE Career Competencies, particularly communication, equity, and leadership. Incorporating structured scoring increased inter-rater reliability and helped us make more consistent, inclusive hiring decisions. The work was grounded in research from Campion et al. (1997) on structured interviews and Klotz et al. (2021) on bias reduction through rubric-based evaluation.

Training & Development

I led the development of training modules and onboarding materials for Campus Connectors and Graduate Assistants. These included slide decks, handbooks, onboarding checklists, and real-world scenario simulations. My training approach combined the ADDIE instructional design model (Branch, 2009) and Vygotsky’s concept of scaffolding — helping trainees build confidence gradually. Peer mentoring was built into the framework, and we collected feedback via post-training surveys. Result: 89% of trainees reported feeling "highly prepared" within their first two weeks on the job.

Employee Experience

Understanding employee experience meant listening to our team’s needs. I created engagement surveys and weekly check-ins to uncover pain points related to communication, workload clarity, and team belonging. Using theories from Herzberg’s Motivation-Hygiene model and Self-Determination Theory (Ryan & Deci, 2000), we introduced regular appreciation shoutouts, clearer instructions via digital boards, and “choose-your-role” shifts for autonomy. The changes resulted in a 25% increase in volunteer retention from semester to semester.

Research & Analytics

My research with classmates focused on Gen Z student employees and the influence of leadership styles on their job satisfaction. We used the Multifactor Leadership Questionnaire (MLQ) and Job Satisfaction Survey (JSS) to collect data. Results indicated that transformational leadership behaviors — especially inspirational motivation and individualized consideration — were positively correlated with satisfaction. I led the data analysis using SPSS, interpreting correlations and creating actionable recommendations for student staff development programs. Our work built on Bass & Avolio’s (1994) leadership theory and Spector’s (1997) work on job satisfaction.

Systems & Innovation

I conceptualized and built a prototype for ThriveLocal — a digital support platform designed for relocated employees and students. The platform connected users with small businesses, local language resources, and community events to combat social isolation. I designed user personas, built a financial model, pitched to faculty, and tested the prototype with peers. The idea stemmed from my understanding of the PERMA model (Seligman, 2011) and the growing need for place-based well-being interventions in global workplaces. The feedback I received emphasized the real-world applicability and value of the project.

); } export default Portfolio;
